notes: A drug suspect and former policeman was shot dead in an attack by unidentified motorcycle-riding men along Ortigas Avenue Extension corner Countryside, Barangay Sta. Lucia, Pasig City assumed on January 20.

assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Philippines); NFSW: National Federation of Sugar Workers; Labour Group (Philippines); FAW: Federation of Agricultural Workers
source: Philippine Star; Bulatlat; ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders
notes: A farmer activist and NFSW leader, a member organization of the FAW, was killed by unidentified armed men near his house in Barangay Pandanon Silos, Murcia area, Negros Occidental on 20 Jan 2017. Karapatan claims it to be a extrajudicial killings by suspected state agents (assumed military) under Oplan Kapayapaan.

Hundreds of Filipinos, led by militant group Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan), staged a protest at the US embassy in Manila on Friday (Jan 20) to denounce Donald Trump ahead of his inauguration as president of the United States, accusing him of sexism, racism and xenophobia. Protesters burnt an American flag and reiterated their long-time demands for US troops to leave the Philippines and the termination of what they called 'unequal' military agreements.

A social activist was shot dead by unidentified men in Surigao del Sur on January 20. The motive is still unclear but human rights activists claim the shooting is part of the ongoing NDFP-Army conflict in the region.

New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas allegedly fired at a truck driver of the Santos Land Development Corporation (SLDC) and commandeered the vehicle in the village of Malasila in Makilala town in North Cotabato on January 20. The driver escaped unharmed.
A drug suspect of the Reyes drug ring was killed in a gun attack by suspected vigilantes in Barangay Sta Ana in San Pablo City, Laguna on January 20.
A drug suspect was shot and killed in a police raid in Santa Rosa City in Laguna on Jan 20.
A drug suspect was shot dead by police in Barangay Poblacion 4, General Mariano Alvarez in Cavite, on Jan 20.
A drug suspect was killed in a gun attack by suspected vigilantes in Barangay Manat in Binmaley city, Pangasinan on January 20 or January 21.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: Two drug suspect were shot and killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at Batangas City, Batangas province on January 20, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: Three drug suspects were shot and killed during a police raid at Quezon City, Metro Manila on January 20, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.
A drug suspect was killed in a gun attack by suspected vigilantes in Barangay Molino, Cavite Bacoor area in Cavite on January 20.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed during a police raid at Quezon City, Metro Manila on January 21, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: Two drug suspects were shot and killed during a police raid at Danao City, Cebu province on January 21, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.
A drug suspect was shot dead by police during a sting in Barangay San Agustin, San Fernando City, Pampanga, on Jan 21.

The Unyon ng mga Manggagawa sa Agrikultura (UMA), a farmers' group based in Negros Occidental, held a protest rally in Bacolod City on January 21 to mark the 30th anniversary celebration of the Mendiola massacre.

Filipinos staged a protest in different parts of Metro Manila on Saturday (Jan 21) to denounce Donald Trump ahead of his inauguration as president of the United States, accusing him of sexism, racism and xenophobia.

Hundreds jeepney operators and drivers marched along downtown Session Road in Baguio City on Saturday (Jan. 21) to protest the government's order to phase out jeepneys that are 15 years old or older by 2018.

A team of soldiers and police encountered New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas at Barangay Biangan in Makilala town area in North Cotabato on January 21 morning, leaving a rebel and eight soldiers dead. Fighting lasted for an hour. The Philippine military claimed that it did not suffer any casualties.

Property destruction: Guerrillas believed to be members of New People's Army torched a truck owned by tobacco giant Philip Morris Fortune Tobacco Corp. in Barangay Mabileg, Sigay town area, Ilocos Sur on January 21.
A drug suspect was shot and killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at Marikina City, Metro Manila on January 22, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed during a police raid at Caloocan City, Metro Manila on January 22, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.
A team of soldiers and police encountered New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas in a 30-minute fire fight assumed in Makilala town area in North Cotabato on January 22.
A drug suspect was shot dead by police during a sting in Rosario town, Cavite, on Jan 22.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed during a police raid at Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu province on January 23, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed by members of the NPA at Davao City, Davao del Sur province on January 23, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List. The NPA claims that they were acting with the support of the government as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: Two drug suspects were shot and killed during a police raid at Caloocan City, Metro Manila on January 23, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.
New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas executed a drug suspect on January 23 in Tabaon, Malabog, Paquibato District in Davao City, Davao del Sur allegedly for being tagged as a drug supplier.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: 2 drug suspects were shot dead by an undercover police officer during a battle in Barangay Dila, Bay town, Laguna, on Jan 23. The police officer was wounded.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: Two drug suspects were shot and killed during a police raid at Aloguinsan town, Cebu province on January 24, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

notes: Two drug suspects were shot and killed during a police raid at Minglanilla town, Cebu province on January 24, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: Two drug suspects, including a former police officer, were shot and killed during a police raid at Norzagaray town, Bulacan province on January 24, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.
People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (P.E.T.A.) activists held a silent protest in a cage to symbolize the plight of chickens at Chinatown district in Manila on January 24.

An unidentified drug suspect was shot and killed during a police raid at Pandi town, Bulacan province on January 24, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

An unidentified drug suspect was shot and killed during a police raid at San Rafael town, Bulacan province on January 24, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.
The Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas (KMP) launched a four-day campout protest in Davao City on January 24, to press the government for their unresolved issues on land, food and social justice.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at Mandaluyong City, Metro Manila on January 24, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.
A drug suspect was shot and killed during a police raid at Quezon City, Metro Manila on January 24, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at Quezon City, Metro Manila on January 25, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Philippines); KMP: Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas
notes: A farmer activist and member of the San Benito Farmers Association-KMP was shot dead in Negros Occidental province on 25 Jan 2017. Karapatan claims it to be a case of extrajudicial killings by suspected state agents (assumed military; coded the capital of Negros Occidental as location with GP 2).
Three members of an Ilonggo clan were injured in rido-related ambush by a Moro family at Barangay Rebuken in Sultan Kudarat town area in Maguindanao late January 25 afternoon.
A drug suspect was shot and killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at Paranaque City, Metro Manila on January 25, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

Government forces launched combined airstrikes and ground offensive against several positions of the Abu Sayyaf and Maute groups in Butig area of Lanao del Sur on Jan. 25. Three rebel camps were seized and about 15 militants including an Indonesian killed. An Abu Sayyaf leader was allegedly severely injured during the attack (Fatalities have been divided for the days of January 25 and January 26).

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: Two drug suspects were shot and killed during a police raid at Malolos City, Bulacan province on January 25, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.
A drug suspect was shot dead by undercover police in Barangay Kapitan Pepe, Cabanatuan City, Nueva Ecija, on Jan 25.
A barangay chairman of Barangay 106, Tondo was shot dead in an ambush by unidentified armed men in Tondo on January 25. The motive for the killing is unclear.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: Three drug suspects were shot and killed during a police raid at Manila, Metro Manila on January 25, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at Tondo, Manila, Metro Manila on January 25, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: Two drug suspects were shot and killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at Pasig City, Metro Manila on January 25, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

A roadside bomb targeting the convoy of Maguindanao's police director detonated in Barangay Nabundas, Shariff Saydona town area early January 25 morning. Police investigators said the outlawed Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters was behind the roadside bombing. No one was hurt.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed during a police raid at Tondo, Manila, Metro Manila on January 26, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed during a police raid at Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu province on January 26, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: An unidentified drug suspect was found dead at Navotas City, Metro Manila on January 26, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at San Jose de Buenavista City, Antique province on January 26, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Manila Times; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A brother of former San Pablo City Mayor was killed in a roadside ambush by unidentified men on Thursday (Jan 26) afternoon along Barangay Del Remedio in San Pablo City, Laguna. President Duterte named them as among political families with members involved in illegal drugs either as users or dealers.

26 January. Government forces continued combined airstrikes and ground offensive against several positions of the Abu Sayyaf and Maute groups in Butig area of Lanao del Sur on Thursday (Jan. 26). Three rebel camps were seized and about 15 militants including an Indonesian killed. (Fatalities have been divided for the days of January 25 and January 26.)

A teenage civilian was shot dead by unidentified armed men at Navotas City, Metro Manila on 26 Jan 2017 and is believed to be a victim of extra judicial killings in President Rodrigo Duterte's 'war on drugs.'

Four unidentified bodyguards for Mayor and drug protector were killed during a shootout with the police at Ampatuan town, Maguindanao province on January 26, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

A drug suspect was shot and killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at Nasugbu town, Batangas province on January 27, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at Pagbilao town, Quezon province on January 27, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

New People's Army (NPA) claimed that three government operatives were killed after a 45-minute firefight in Brgy. Taguranao, Matalam area, North Cotabato where government forces from the 71st Infantry Battalion, militiamen and members of the police Special Action Force launched an operation early in the morning of January 27.

On Friday (Jan 27), hundreds of activists held a rally in front of the Philippine National Police (PNP) headquarters in Camp Crame in Quezon City to denounce the culture of impunity and rising human rights violations in the government's war on drugs. They also protested against the abduction and killing of Korean Jee Ick-joo by policemen. The protesters included members from Bagong Alayansang Makabayan (Bayan) and the League of Filipino Students (LFS).

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: Three drug suspects were shot dead by suspected vigilantes in Taguig City before dawn on January 28.

A village chief in Tanza town in Cavite province was shot dead and his wife was hurt in an ambush by motorcycle-riding gunmen at Barangay Bagtas, Tanza town, Cavite province on January 28. The police have yet to determine a motive in the shooting.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug surrenderee was killed in a gun attack by suspected vigilantes in Pasig on January 28 night.

Two bomb explosions rocked separate places almost simultaneously in Lamitan City, Basilan, on Saturday night (January 28). No one was killed or injured in the explosions. The police suspects an urban militant group linked to the Abu Sayyaf behind the explosion.

A politician and his helper were wounded in an attack by unidentified men assumed in San Jorge, Samar in the week from January 23 to January 29. The attack is part of a political rivalry between a San Jorge town mayor and the wounded politician.

Suspected Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) militants with rocket-propelled grenades and assault rifles attacked an Army base in Barangay Pagangan, Aleosan area in North Cotabato at 9 p.m. Saturday (Jan. 28). No casualties were reported on the government side.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: An undetermined number of suspected Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) rebels attacked the 7th Infantry Battalion and members of the Civilian Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) along the national highway in Barangay Nalapaan, Pikit town, early Sunday (Jan. 29). No casualty was reported on the government side.
New People's Army (NPA) rebels allegedly abducted a Private First Class of the 30th Infantry Battalion in Alegria area, Surigao del Norte on January 29.

A former village chief was shot and killed by an unidentified gunman at a wake on Sunday night (Jan. 29) assumed at Guminga village in San Pablo area, Isabela. Police have not yet determined the motive for the attack.

Property destruction: About 30 suspected members of the New People's Army (NPA) wearing Air Force uniforms stormed the security detachment of Costa del Hamilo Inc. (CDHI) offsite office compound at Sitio Hamilo, Barangay Papaya in Nasugbu area, Batangas on Sunday (Jan 29) and burned its staff house and driver's quarters.

Two children were killed while three others were wounded in a roadside bomb explosion in Al Barka town in Basilan on Sunday morning (Jan. 29). No group has claimed responsibility but the military blamed the incident on the Abu Sayyaf militants that operate on the island province.

New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas attacked a PDTs outpost in Mahayahay, Kitcharao town in Agusan del Norte areas past midnight of January 30. No fatalities were reported but some soldiers were wounded.
A police officer was stabbed (injured) by a suspected drug dealer during a sting in Barangay Nancayasan, Urdaneta City in Pangasinan, on Jan 30.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed during a police raid at San Mateo town, Rizal province on January 30, 2017 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

Two Army soldiers were killed in an ambush staged by New People's Army rebels at the boundary of Barangays (villages) Benguet and Mabbayad in Echague area, Isabela on Monday morning (Jan. 30). Soldiers from the 86th Infantry Battalion have launched pursuit operations against the attackers.

New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas attacked a PDTs outpost in Hinambangan, Kitcharao town area and Mahayahay town in Agusan del Norte areas past midnight of January 30. No casualties were reported but some soldiers were wounded.

New People's Army (NPA) rebels attacked militiamen under the 72nd and 73rd Infantry Battalion securing a road rehabilitation project in Sitio Banlibato, Brgy Pag-asa, Alabel in Sarangani past 2pm on January 30.
Suspected New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas attacked government forces in Compostella province some time between January 29 and January 31. No casualties were reported.
A drug suspect was shot dead by police in Barangay Santa Teresita, Baao town in Camarines Sur, on Jan 30.

Suspected New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas attacked government forces and threw two hand grenades at troops undertaking relief operations in Barangay Concepcion, Valencia City area in Bukidnon on January 3O. The grenades did not explode and no casualties were reported.

New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas attacked government troops at a peace and development team (PDT) outpost at Mat-i, Surigao City on Monday night (Jan 30). No casualties were reported but some soldiers were wounded.

Members of the militant youth group League of Filipino Students staged a protest rally in front of the Embassy of the United States of America in Manila on Monday morning (Jan. 30) to protest the Enhanced Defence Cooperation Agreement (EDCA) between the Philippines and US and Trump's 'Muslim travel ban' order.

Around 10 armed men believed to be New People's Army (NPA) rebels held security guards at gunpoint at a Musahamat Plantation at Barangay Union in Monkayo area, Davao de Oro and took away a shot gun, calibre 38 pistol, keys of a backhoe and dump truck and mobile phones on January 30.

New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas attacked a PDTs outpost in San Isidro, Kitcharao town area in Agusan del Norte areas past midnight of January 30. No fatalities were reported but some soldiers were wounded.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Scout Ranger
notes: 31 January. Five suspected Abu Sayyaf militants led by Alhabsy Misaya were killed while nine others - including two soldiers - were injured in two separate encounters with Army Scout Rangers both in Barangay Pugad Manual in Panamao, Sulu on Tuesday (Jan 31).

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: Two drug suspects were shot dead by suspected vigilantes at their house in Barangay Sta Rita in Olongapo City on January 31, 2017.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead by suspected vigilantes in Pasig city, Metro Manila, on January 31.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Channel News Asia
notes: Two drug suspects were shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in two separate shootings in Manila on January 31 night.
A former radio broadcaster was gunned down by unidentified men on Tuesday morning (Jan. 31) in downtown Isabela City, Basilan.
Three persons were wounded in explosions at the houses of a mayor of San Jorge town, Samar on January 31. The attack is part of a political rivalry.

The environmental group Kalikasan People's Network for the Environment (Kalikasan PNE) staged a demonstration outside the Chinese Consulate in Manila on January 31, to protest the continuous construction of military bases in the West Philippine Sea (South China Sea).
